assemble.step1: 1. Make sure that the BEEP base that you want to configure is nearby and powered.
assemble.step2: 2. Get out the 3.5mm sample microphone plug and plug in the microphone.
assemble.nb: NB: You can plug in the rubber pads to support your hive later.

wakeUp.buttonTitle: For BEEP base model version 3.3 and newer
wakeUp.button: Activate the Bluetooth by pressing the button shortly.
wakeUp.magnet: Use the magnet and hold it next to the microphone plug.
wakeUp.all: Two short beeps will indicate that Bluetooth is activated.

pair.description:
Below you find a list with BEEP bases that were found. Click on a BEEP base to connect to it and have it play a sound.

When you are certain you have selected the correct device, press Next.

state.hardwareId: Retrieving hardware ID of BEEP base...
state.notYetRegistered:
This BEEP base is not yet registered.

In order to configure this BEEP base, it must be registered to your BEEP account.

After successful registration, it will be reset to factory default settings.
state.registered: This BEEP base is successfully registered to your account.
state.alreadyRegistered: This BEEP base is already registered to your account.
state.failed: Could not register this BEEP base.
state.deviceAlreadyLinkedToAnotherAccount:
This BEEP base is already registered to another account.

Ask the person you acquired your BEEP base from to transfer it to you.

register.name: Name
register.registerButton: Register this BEEP base to your account

calibrate.description: Inspect each of the sensors below in order to configure and calibrate them.

temperature.step1: 1. Warm up one of the sensors in your hand and check which sensor temperature is increasing.
temperature.step2: 2. Name that sensor e.g. "inside brood layer".
temperature.step3: 3. Attach a label to the sensor cable.

weight.confirmMessage:
It appears that your weight sensor has already been tared.

You should only tare without any weight on the BEEP base, so never do this when it is installed under a hive.

Do you really want to tare again?

page.tare:
In order to calibrate the weight sensor, we must first determine the tare weight, or zero value.

Make sure nothing is on the scale and press the button below to set the tare weight.
page.calibrate: Enter your exact weight in kg below, step on the scale and press the calibrate button below.

state.timeout: Weight sensor did not respond in time
state.tareDeviationTooLarge: Please make sure that there is nothing placed on top of the scale, and that you do not apply any weight while the weight sensor is being sampled.
state.calibrateDeviationTooLarge: Please remain still on the scale, while the weight sensor is being sampled.

plug.description: Check the specifications of your microphone and select the ring/tip to which the signal line is connected.

frequencies.description:
Specify the observed frequency range.

The observed range will be divided into the number of bins you specify.

home.introduction: Below you find a list of BEEP bases that are currently associated with your account.

peripheralDetail.instructions: Wake up your BEEP base by pressing the button shortly (v3.3 and newer) or by holding the magnet next to the microphone plug (older versions). Then press the Connect above to read out the device details and change several settings. Settings can also be changed using ‘Configure new BEEP base’.

firmware.newerAvailableDescription: There is a newer version available
firmware.ENABLING_DFU_MODE: Initializing BEEP base for firmware upload
